item.title: 3D k-means Clustering
item.description: Wikipedia k-means clustering is a method of vector quantization, originally from signal processing, that aims to partition n observations into k clusters in which each observation belongs to the cluster with the nearest mean (cluster centers or cluster centroid), serving as a prototype of the cluster. This results in a partitioning of the data space into Voronoi cells. K=2 ![Desktop View](https://i.imgur.com/ZWxy72b.gif){: width="auto" height="auto" } K=3 ![Desktop View](https://i.imgur.com/YM1LT77.gif){: width="auto" height="auto" } K=4 !
